com.google.publicalerts.cap.profile
Interface CapProfile

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCapProfile, AustralianProfile, CanadianProfile, GoogleProfile, Ipaws1Profile
public interface CapProfile

Specifies a set of extra constraints on the CAP format. The constraints are usually country-specific.

Method Summary
 List<CapException.Reason> checkForErrors(AlertOrBuilder alert)
          Checks the given alert against the profile and returns a list of errors explaining how the alert does not match the profile.
 List<CapException.Reason> checkForRecommendations(AlertOrBuilder alert)
          Checks the given alert against suggestions and best-practices recommended by the profile.
 String getCode()
          Returns a code unique to the profile.
 String getDocumentationUrl()
          Returns the canonical URL of the official document describing the profile.
 String getName()
          Returns the name of the profile, suitable for display.
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Returns the name of the profile, suitable for display.

Returns:
the name of the profile

getCode

String getCode()
Returns a code unique to the profile. Ideally, it will include a version number.

Returns:
a unique code identifying the profile

getDocumentationUrl

String getDocumentationUrl()
Returns the canonical URL of the official document describing the profile.

Returns:
the documentation url

checkForErrors

List<CapException.Reason> checkForErrors(AlertOrBuilder alert)
Checks the given alert against the profile and returns a list of errors explaining how the alert does not match the profile. The profile should assume that the given alert is valid CAP and check only the extra constraints it specifies.

Parameters:
alert - the alert to check
Returns:
errors errors found during the check, an empty list if there are none

checkForRecommendations

List<CapException.Reason> checkForRecommendations(AlertOrBuilder alert)
Checks the given alert against suggestions and best-practices recommended by the profile. An alert not adhering to these recommendations would still be accepted by whatever system that claims to require alerts adhering to the profile, but adopting the recommendations allows for more full compatibility and perhaps extra features.

Parameters:
alert - the alert to check
Returns:
recommendations found during the check, an empty list if there are none
